MazeObjects

Class MazeObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeObjects.MazeObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bottom, Box, CustomMazeObject, Empty, FinishTile, Floor, Pit, Ramp, SkyBox, StartTile

    public abstract class MazeObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains the a number of points, represented by vectors, and faces, to create three dimensional objects that are in the maze.

      • getNumVertices

        public int getNumVertices()

      • getRotation

        public int[] getRotation()
        The rotation of the MazeObject is found by comparing its three normals to the three unity vectors after rotating the same amount as the object.
        Returns:
        rotation around the x, y and z axis stored in an array.

      • getNumFaces

        public int getNumFaces()

      • setTop

        public void setTop(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the top face(s) of the mazeObject, if it has one. A top face is defined as a face that only connects vertices that are (almost) as high as the highest point of the MazeObject.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Boolean representing whether the top faces should be enabled or disabled.

      • hasBottom

        public boolean hasBottom(float bottomHeight)

      • addFace

        public void addFace(int[] faceArray)
        Add a face to the list of faces. The face must contain at least three numbers of the vertices it connects, and those vertices must already be in the list of vertices.
        Parameters:
        faceArray - array of the numbers of the vertices the face connects

      • addFace

        public void addFace(int[] faceArray,
           int[] texArray)
        Add a face to the list of faces. The face must contain at least three numbers of the vertices it connects, and those vertices must already be in the list of vertices. Also, it must contain a equal number of texture vertex numbers, and those vertices must also already be in the texture vertices array.
        Parameters:
        faceArray - array of the numbers of the vertices the face connects
        texArray - array of the numbers of texture vertices the face connects

      • draw

        public void draw(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
        float[] wallColour)
        Draw the object
        Parameters:
        gl -
        wallColour - Colour the object should get

                   double yRotate,

        Rotates all vertices around the X axis in a given point.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle with which needs to be rotated
        yRotate - Y coordinate of the point around which is to be rotated
        zRotate - Z coordinate of the point around which is to be rotated
